data: Fragments of foot and base of a black-glaze cup.

The text consists of two inscriptions, arranged on two different parts of the same object. 
                                        The first one (fragment a) is on the underside of the foot: it is arranged in a clockwise spiral, on two lines. 
                                        The second one (fragment b) is on the bottom of the interior of the cup and is arranged following a linear pattern on four lines.

Accidentally found by a local shepherd in the excavations area and attributed (Voza 1966, p.218, n.7) to the Segesta area of Grotta Vanella, on the north-east slope of Monte Barbaro, 1.9km east of temple of Segesta.
I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana
Partially reopened following extensive restoration work. Comprehensive collection of archaeological material, predominantly from the West of the island, with an important Etruscan collection.
Centre of Palermo, Piazza Olivella 24, 90100 - Palermo

Fragments of foot and base of a black-glaze cup.

ceramic cup scratched

The text consists of two inscriptions, arranged on two different parts of the same object. The first one (fragment a) is on the underside of the foot: it is arranged in a clockwise spiral, on two lines. The second one (fragment b) is on the bottom of the interior of the cup and is arranged following a linear pattern on four lines.
